queue.name: Database path is relative — ghost DB causes stale data on fresh start
queue.description: DATABASE_URL in backend/models/__init__.py line 25 uses relative path 'sqlite+aiosqlite:///./hubllm.db'. This creates the DB wherever uvicorn's CWD is — usually backend/ (correct), but if launched from repo root, a second hubllm.db appears at Hub-LLM/hubllm.db. After deleting one DB to reset, the ghost DB still exists with old user data, causing 'Email already registered' on signup. Additionally init.sh has no DB cleanup step. Refs: learnings line 9 (BUG-29 init_db fix), line 1321 (had to delete hubllm.db to recreate schema), line 1391 (documents ./hubllm.db created on first run).
change: backend/models/__init__.py line 25: Replace relative path with absolute path anchored to the file's own directory. Use `Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent / 'hubllm.db'` so DB always lands at backend/hubllm.db regardless of CWD. Keep the env var override so DATABASE_URL can still be set externally.

init.sh: Add a --fresh flag or unconditional cleanup step before starting backend. Use `find /root/dev/Hub-LLM -name 'hubllm.db' -delete` to remove ALL hubllm.db files (not just backend/hubllm.db). Print which files were deleted. Place this BEFORE the uvicorn launch (after line 52, before line 54).
init.sh line 140: Update the summary to show the resolved absolute path so the operator can verify which DB is in use.
queue.test: Step-by-step: (1) find /root/dev/Hub-LLM -name hubllm.db — note any files. (2) Delete all found files. (3) Run init.sh from repo root. (4) Verify only backend/hubllm.db exists: find /root/dev/Hub-LLM -name hubllm.db. (5) Signup a new user — should succeed. (6) Stop backend, cd to repo root, run 'cd /root/dev/Hub-LLM && python -c "from backend.models import DATABASE_URL; print(DATABASE_URL)"' — should show absolute path containing /backend/hubllm.db. Paste the find output and DATABASE_URL print as evidence.
queue.completion_note: Changed backend/models/__init__.py: replaced relative './hubllm.db' with absolute path via Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent / 'hubllm.db'. Added ghost DB cleanup in init.sh Step 0. Updated init.sh summary to show resolved path. Test evidence: python -c 'from backend.models import DATABASE_URL; print(DATABASE_URL)' outputs 'sqlite+aiosqlite:////root/dev/Hub-LLM/backend/hubllm.db'. find shows only backend/hubllm.db exists. Affected areas: any code importing DATABASE_URL from backend.models.

queue.name: Setup wizard skip — Postgres missing setup_completed column
queue.description: Root cause: Production runs Postgres via Docker (docker-compose.yml line 11: DATABASE_URL=postgresql://hubllm:hubllm@db:5432/hubllm). The ORM model User has setup_completed (backend/models/__init__.py line 75) but SQLAlchemy's create_all only creates NEW tables in Postgres — it never adds columns to existing tables. The users table was created before setup_completed was added, so the column doesn't exist in production. The original BUG-28 fix (null-init timing in frontend) was correct for a separate issue but didn't address this. Additionally, init_db() at line 242 uses 'SELECT name FROM sqlite_master' which is SQLite-specific and will silently fail on Postgres. ALSO: SYNC_DATABASE_URL at line 30 does replace('+aiosqlite', '') which produces garbage for Postgres URLs.
change: IMMEDIATE FIX: Run ALTER TABLE users ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS setup_completed BOOLEAN DEFAULT false; on the production Postgres DB. Can be done via: docker exec -it <postgres_container> psql -U hubllm -d hubllm -c "ALTER TABLE users ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS setup_completed BOOLEAN DEFAULT false;"

backend/models/__init__.py lines 230-249: Make init_db() DB-engine-aware. If DATABASE_URL starts with 'postgresql', use information_schema.tables instead of sqlite_master for table verification. Handle SYNC_DATABASE_URL construction for both SQLite and Postgres (line 30 replacement is SQLite-only).

NEW FILE backend/migrations/001_add_setup_completed.py: Create a simple migration script that checks if setup_completed column exists and adds it if not. This serves as the first migration and the pattern for future migrations.
backend/main.py startup: After create_all, run any pending migration scripts from backend/migrations/ in order.
queue.test: Step-by-step: (1) Connect to Postgres: docker exec into postgres container, psql -U hubllm -d hubllm. (2) Run: SELECT column_name FROM information_schema.columns WHERE table_name='users'; — verify setup_completed appears. (3) Sign up a new user. (4) Verify /api/auth/me returns setup_completed: false. (5) Complete setup wizard. (6) Verify /api/auth/me returns setup_completed: true. Paste the column listing and /api/auth/me responses as evidence.
queue.completion_note: Changed backend/models/__init__.py: (1) Fixed SYNC_DATABASE_URL — now branches on IS_POSTGRES, converts postgresql:// to +asyncpg for async engine, strips for sync. (2) Fixed init_db() — uses information_schema.tables for Postgres, sqlite_master for SQLite. (3) Added run_migrations() — runs backend/migrations/NNN_*.py scripts after create_all. Created backend/migrations/001_add_setup_completed.py — adds setup_completed column via ALTER TABLE if missing (uses SQLAlchemy inspect, works on both SQLite and Postgres). Added psycopg2-binary to requirements.txt. Test evidence: Local SQLite — DATABASE_URL resolves to sqlite+aiosqlite:////root/dev/Hub-LLM/backend/hubllm.db, SYNC_DATABASE_URL=sqlite:////root/dev/Hub-LLM/backend/hubllm.db. Postgres — DATABASE_URL converts postgresql:// to postgresql+asyncpg://, SYNC stays postgresql://. Migration tested on temp DB: column missing → added; column exists → skipped. Production Postgres test requires Docker deployment (Coolify auto-deploys from main).

queue.name: Map production deployment architecture (Docker/Coolify/Traefik/Postgres)
queue.description: The CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml and CLAUDE.md only document SQLite local dev. Production runs an entirely different stack via Docker that was never documented. 85+ sessions of development happened without this knowledge, causing BUG-28-REOPEN. The deployment architecture MUST be mapped so every future task accounts for the dual-DB reality. Key files to document: docker-compose.yml (root), backend/Dockerfile, frontend/Dockerfile. Key facts: (1) Production DB is Postgres 16 (docker-compose line 43: postgres:16-alpine), (2) Redis 7 is available (line 48), (3) FRONTEND_URL env var controls CORS (line 13), (4) APP_URL=https://hubllm.dev (line 14), (5) Coolify on the server manages deploys from main branch, (6) Traefik handles HTTPS termination and routing for hubllm.dev, (7) Backend volume-mounts ./backend:/app for hot reload in dev containers.
change: harness/CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml: Add a new top-level 'deployment' section documenting the Docker/Coolify/Traefik/Postgres stack, container definitions, environment variables, and the dual-DB reality (Postgres prod / SQLite dev).
harness/CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml: Update meta.stack from 'FastAPI (Python) + React (Vite) + SQLite' to 'FastAPI (Python) + React (Vite) + SQLite (dev) / Postgres (prod)'.
harness/CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml: Update database.engine to note the DATABASE_URL env override and Postgres production config.
CLAUDE.md: Add a 'Production Deployment' section under Critical Patterns documenting Docker + Postgres + the dual-DB rule.
Director CLAUDE.md (this repo): Update Environment and Architecture sections to reflect production stack.
queue.test: Verify: (1) CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml has a 'deployment' section with docker-compose services listed. (2) CLAUDE.md has Postgres/migration rules. (3) Director CLAUDE.md mentions Postgres production. Paste the relevant section headers as evidence.

_templates._note: These templates are the REQUIRED format. Both Director and Engineer must follow them exactly.

new_task._when: Director creates this when writing a new task
new_task.name: Short descriptive name
new_task.description: Root cause analysis with file paths and line numbers from CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml. Include learnings session refs. Be specific.
change: file/path.ext line N: specific change description
file/path.ext line N: specific change description
new_task.test: Step-by-step: (1) do X, (2) expect Y. REQUIRED: specify what output to paste in completion_note as evidence.
new_task.investigation_id: INV-XX or null if no investigation was needed

engineer_signoff._filled_by: Lead Engineer when task is done
_rules: completion_note MUST be 30+ words with file paths and test evidence
All checklist items MUST be true
If task test field says 'paste X', you MUST paste X in completion_note
engineer_signoff.completion_note: Changed [files]. Fixed [what]. Test evidence: [paste actual output — sqlite3 results, curl responses, browser console, etc]. Affected areas: [what else might be impacted].

_rules: Check completion_note has test evidence (not just description)
Check status was set to pending_review (not done/completed)
Check CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml was updated: git log -3 -- harness/CODEBASE_INDEX.yaml
Check all checklist items are true
Spot-check one file's line count against index entry
REJECT if any check fails — set status back to pending with rejection_note
director_review.review_notes: Verified: [what was checked]. Index commit: [hash]. Test evidence confirmed: [what was verified].

completed_task._note: This is what goes in the 'completed' array. PRESERVE all fields — never strip down to just id/name/date.
completed_task.name: Short descriptive name
completed_task.completion_note: PRESERVED from engineer — never delete this

investigation_request._created_by: Director when Gate 1 fails (index missing or stale)
investigation_request._handed_to: Code Researcher agent via: 'Investigate the request at harness/investigations/active/INV-XX.md'
investigation_request._flow: Director fills request → spawns Code Researcher → agent reads request, scans code, writes to index, saves report → Director reads report → Director writes task
